Wind Energy.Description: Wind energy is harnessed through the use of wind turbines, which convert the kinetic energy of the wind into electrical energy.
Wind energy is generated by large-scale wind farms, which consist of multiple wind turbines strategically placed in areas with high wind potential.
Wind energy is a key component of the broader concept of renewable energy, which aims to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and mitigate climate change.
Wind energy requires effective grid integration to ensure the smooth and reliable transmission of electricity from wind farms to consumers.
